instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.
definitions.820-00150: What is 820-00150? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid senor issue
threads.message: Hi ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00150</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in totally dead , (charger faulty) had to replace 4 usb controllers and <CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP> , now board working apart from if you close the lid the laptop will not wake the screen, same on battery power or mains power , you have to hold your finger on the power button to force off then power on again and screen will display , even if you tell the laptop to turn off , wait for it to shut down then close the lid and try to turn on , no display again, would it be <CHIP>U6650</CHIP> as this looks like it controls both left and right smc lid sensors, or am i in the complete wrong place ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid senor issue
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT signals reaction at J4800/01, when lid is closed/open.
